p: In addition, the antimicrobial activity of bornyl acetate and camphor has been demonstrated by several works. Indeed, Bougatsos et al. [ 42], Vagionas et al. [ 43], and Runyoro et al. [ 44] report MICs ranging from 1.75 to 4.88 mg/mL for bornyl acetate against several microbial strains. On the other hand, esters and especially bornyl acetate (30.74%) also contribute to the antibacterial effect. Based on the work of Tzakou et al. [ 45], the essential oils of two chemotypes of Thymus longicaulis rich in geranyl acetate for the first and in acetate α-terpenyl for the second possess a high antimicrobial activity.
